Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Hiring freshers can bring fresh energy, new perspectives, and a long-term investment in talent. While they may lack direct experience, fresh graduates often come with a strong academic foundation, a willingness to learn, and a high level of adaptability. They are eager to prove themselves and can quickly adapt to company culture, bringing innovative ideas and enthusiasm to the workplace.By hiring freshers, companies can mold and shape talent to meet their specific needs, building a workforce that is loyal and aligned with the company's values and goals.Additionally, freshers are often more cost-effective in terms of salary and can grow within the organization, reducing recruitment costs in the long run. Investing in young talent also helps create a diverse and dynamic team, ensuring that businesses stay ahead of industry trends by fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.Ultimately, hiring freshers is an opportunity for organizations to invest in the future, building a sustainable and motivated workforce that can drive long-term success.hashtag#hiring hashtag#partimehashtag#fulltime hashtag#workinghashtag#onlineworkinghashtag#hiring hashtag#nowhashtag#partimehashtag#oportunityhashtag#workfromhomehashtag#workfromofficehashtag#delhi hashtag#noidahashtag#linkdin hashtag#india

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Hiring freshers can bring fresh energy, new perspectives, and a long-term investment in talent. While they may lack direct experience, fresh graduates often come with a strong academic foundation, a willingness to learn, and a high level of adaptability. They are eager to prove themselves and can quickly adapt to company culture, bringing innovative ideas and enthusiasm to the workplace.By hiring freshers, companies can mold and shape talent to meet their specific needs, building a workforce that is loyal and aligned with the company's values and goals.Additionally, freshers are often more cost-effective in terms of salary and can grow within the organization, reducing recruitment costs in the long run. Investing in young talent also helps create a diverse and dynamic team, ensuring that businesses stay ahead of industry trends by fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.Ultimately, hiring freshers is an opportunity for organizations to invest in the future, building a sustainable and motivated workforce that can drive long-term success.hashtag#hiring hashtag#partimehashtag#fulltime hashtag#workinghashtag#onlineworkinghashtag#hiring hashtag#nowhashtag#partimehashtag#oportunityhashtag#workfromhomehashtag#workfromofficehashtag#delhi hashtag#noidahashtag#linkdin hashtag#india

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Hiring freshers can bring fresh energy, new perspectives, and a long-term investment in talent. While they may lack direct experience, fresh graduates often come with a strong academic foundation, a willingness to learn, and a high level of adaptability. They are eager to prove themselves and can quickly adapt to company culture, bringing innovative ideas and enthusiasm to the workplace.By hiring freshers, companies can mold and shape talent to meet their specific needs, building a workforce that is loyal and aligned with the company's values and goals.Additionally, freshers are often more cost-effective in terms of salary and can grow within the organization, reducing recruitment costs in the long run. Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Hiring freshers can bring fresh energy, new perspectives, and a long-term investment in talent. While they may lack direct experience, fresh graduates often come with a strong academic foundation, a willingness to learn, and a high level of adaptability. They are eager to prove themselves and can quickly adapt to company culture, bringing innovative ideas and enthusiasm to the workplace.By hiring freshers, companies can mold and shape talent to meet their specific needs, building a workforce that is loyal and aligned with the company's values and goals.Additionally, freshers are often more cost-effective in terms of salary and can grow within the organization, reducing recruitment costs in the long run. Investing in young talent also helps create a diverse and dynamic team, ensuring that businesses stay ahead of industry trends by fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.Ultimately, hiring freshers is an opportunity for organizations to invest in the future, building a sustainable and motivated workforce that can drive long-term success.hashtag#hiring hashtag#partimehashtag#fulltime hashtag#workinghashtag#onlineworkinghashtag#hiring hashtag#nowhashtag#partimehashtag#oportunityhashtag#workfromhomehashtag#workfromofficehashtag#delhi hashtag#noidahashtag#linkdin hashtag#india

Hello everyone, let us discuss the another topic today,shall we..!!Here it is,Tittle:Informed Consent Form (ICF): A Cornerstone of Ethical Clinical ResearchAfter the Protocol is developed and approved, the next critical step in any clinical trial is the preparation of the Informed Consent Form (ICF).Why is the ICF so important?It ensures that every participant:‚úÖ Understands the purpose of the study‚úÖ Is aware of the procedures, risks, and benefits‚úÖ Knows their rights, including the right to withdraw at any time‚úÖ Voluntarily agrees to participateKey Highlights:‚Äì Ethical obligation: Upholds respect for participants' autonomy‚Äì Regulatory requirement: No enrollment without IRB/IEC-approved ICF‚Äì Participant-centered: Must be clear, concise, and in layman's termsRemember:The ICF is not just a form ‚Äì it's a meaningful conversation that builds trust between the researcher and the participant.What are your thoughts on improving ICF comprehension and accessibility?hashtag#ClinicalResearch hashtag#InformedConsent hashtag#ICF hashtag#EthicsInResearch hashtag#ClinicalTrials hashtag#GCP hashtag#PatientCentricity hashtag#ResearchEthics hashtag#ClinicalOperations hashtag#hiring hashtag#Recuirters hashtag#Jobsearch hashtag#Fresher hashtag#Fresherhiring hashtag#hiringalter hashtag#jobalter hashtag#openings hashtag#immediatejoining

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Hiring freshers can bring fresh energy, new perspectives, and a long-term investment in talent. While they may lack direct experience, fresh graduates often come with a strong academic foundation, a willingness to learn, and a high level of adaptability. They are eager to prove themselves and can quickly adapt to company culture, bringing innovative ideas and enthusiasm to the workplace.By hiring freshers, companies can mold and shape talent to meet their specific needs, building a workforce that is loyal and aligned with the company's values and goals.Additionally, freshers are often more cost-effective in terms of salary and can grow within the organization, reducing recruitment costs in the long run. Investing in young talent also helps create a diverse and dynamic team, ensuring that businesses stay ahead of industry trends by fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.Ultimately, hiring freshers is an opportunity for organizations to invest in the future, building a sustainable and motivated workforce that can drive long-term success.hashtag#hiring hashtag#partimehashtag#fulltime hashtag#workinghashtag#onlineworkinghashtag#hiring hashtag#nowhashtag#partimehashtag#oportunityhashtag#workfromhomehashtag#workfromofficehashtag#delhi hashtag#noidahashtag#linkdin hashtag#india

Hello everyone, let us discuss the another topic today,shall we..!!Here it is,Tittle:Informed Consent Form (ICF): A Cornerstone of Ethical Clinical ResearchAfter the Protocol is developed and approved, the next critical step in any clinical trial is the preparation of the Informed Consent Form (ICF).Why is the ICF so important?It ensures that every participant:‚úÖ Understands the purpose of the study‚úÖ Is aware of the procedures, risks, and benefits‚úÖ Knows their rights, including the right to withdraw at any time‚úÖ Voluntarily agrees to participateKey Highlights:‚Äì Ethical obligation: Upholds respect for participants' autonomy‚Äì Regulatory requirement: No enrollment without IRB/IEC-approved ICF‚Äì Participant-centered: Must be clear, concise, and in layman's termsRemember:The ICF is not just a form ‚Äì it's a meaningful conversation that builds trust between the researcher and the participant.What are your thoughts on improving ICF comprehension and accessibility?hashtag#ClinicalResearch hashtag#InformedConsent hashtag#ICF hashtag#EthicsInResearch hashtag#ClinicalTrials hashtag#GCP hashtag#PatientCentricity hashtag#ResearchEthics hashtag#ClinicalOperations hashtag#hiring hashtag#Recuirters hashtag#Jobsearch hashtag#Fresher hashtag#Fresherhiring hashtag#hiringalter hashtag#jobalter hashtag#openings hashtag#immediatejoining

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Hiring freshers can bring fresh energy, new perspectives, and a long-term investment in talent. While they may lack direct experience, fresh graduates often come with a strong academic foundation, a willingness to learn, and a high level of adaptability. They are eager to prove themselves and can quickly adapt to company culture, bringing innovative ideas and enthusiasm to the workplace.By hiring freshers, companies can mold and shape talent to meet their specific needs, building a workforce that is loyal and aligned with the company's values and goals.Additionally, freshers are often more cost-effective in terms of salary and can grow within the organization, reducing recruitment costs in the long run. Investing in young talent also helps create a diverse and dynamic team, ensuring that businesses stay ahead of industry trends by fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.Ultimately, hiring freshers is an opportunity for organizations to invest in the future, building a sustainable and motivated workforce that can drive long-term success.hashtag#hiring hashtag#partimehashtag#fulltime hashtag#workinghashtag#onlineworkinghashtag#hiring hashtag#nowhashtag#partimehashtag#oportunityhashtag#workfromhomehashtag#workfromofficehashtag#delhi hashtag#noidahashtag#linkdin hashtag#india

Hello everyone, let us discuss the another topic today,shall we..!!Here it is,Tittle:Informed Consent Form (ICF): A Cornerstone of Ethical Clinical ResearchAfter the Protocol is developed and approved, the next critical step in any clinical trial is the preparation of the Informed Consent Form (ICF).Why is the ICF so important?It ensures that every participant:‚úÖ Understands the purpose of the study‚úÖ Is aware of the procedures, risks, and benefits‚úÖ Knows their rights, including the right to withdraw at any time‚úÖ Voluntarily agrees to participateKey Highlights:‚Äì Ethical obligation: Upholds respect for participants' autonomy‚Äì Regulatory requirement: No enrollment without IRB/IEC-approved ICF‚Äì Participant-centered: Must be clear, concise, and in layman's termsRemember:The ICF is not just a form ‚Äì it's a meaningful conversation that builds trust between the researcher and the participant.What are your thoughts on improving ICF comprehension and accessibility?hashtag#ClinicalResearch hashtag#InformedConsent hashtag#ICF hashtag#EthicsInResearch hashtag#ClinicalTrials hashtag#GCP hashtag#PatientCentricity hashtag#ResearchEthics hashtag#ClinicalOperations hashtag#hiring hashtag#Recuirters hashtag#Jobsearch hashtag#Fresher hashtag#Fresherhiring hashtag#hiringalter hashtag#jobalter hashtag#openings hashtag#immediatejoining

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Hiring freshers can bring fresh energy, new perspectives, and a long-term investment in talent. While they may lack direct experience, fresh graduates often come with a strong academic foundation, a willingness to learn, and a high level of adaptability. They are eager to prove themselves and can quickly adapt to company culture, bringing innovative ideas and enthusiasm to the workplace.By hiring freshers, companies can mold and shape talent to meet their specific needs, building a workforce that is loyal and aligned with the company's values and goals.Additionally, freshers are often more cost-effective in terms of salary and can grow within the organization, reducing recruitment costs in the long run. Investing in young talent also helps create a diverse and dynamic team, ensuring that businesses stay ahead of industry trends by fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.Ultimately, hiring freshers is an opportunity for organizations to invest in the future, building a sustainable and motivated workforce that can drive long-term success.hashtag#hiring hashtag#partimehashtag#fulltime hashtag#workinghashtag#onlineworkinghashtag#hiring hashtag#nowhashtag#partimehashtag#oportunityhashtag#workfromhomehashtag#workfromofficehashtag#delhi hashtag#noidahashtag#linkdin hashtag#india

Hello everyone, let us discuss the another topic today,shall we..!!Here it is,Tittle:Informed Consent Form (ICF): A Cornerstone of Ethical Clinical ResearchAfter the Protocol is developed and approved, the next critical step in any clinical trial is the preparation of the Informed Consent Form (ICF).Why is the ICF so important?It ensures that every participant:‚úÖ Understands the purpose of the study‚úÖ Is aware of the procedures, risks, and benefits‚úÖ Knows their rights, including the right to withdraw at any time‚úÖ Voluntarily agrees to participateKey Highlights:‚Äì Ethical obligation: Upholds respect for participants' autonomy‚Äì Regulatory requirement: No enrollment without IRB/IEC-approved ICF‚Äì Participant-centered: Must be clear, concise, and in layman's termsRemember:The ICF is not just a form ‚Äì it's a meaningful conversation that builds trust between the researcher and the participant.What are your thoughts on improving ICF comprehension and accessibility?hashtag#ClinicalResearch hashtag#InformedConsent hashtag#ICF hashtag#EthicsInResearch hashtag#ClinicalTrials hashtag#GCP hashtag#PatientCentricity hashtag#ResearchEthics hashtag#ClinicalOperations hashtag#hiring hashtag#Recuirters hashtag#Jobsearch hashtag#Fresher hashtag#Fresherhiring hashtag#hiringalter hashtag#jobalter hashtag#openings hashtag#immediatejoining

Not all HR is strategic. But it can be.A while back, we started noticing a pattern in feedback from our new hires at Codistan:‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt really sure what to expect.‚ÄùIt wasn‚Äôt a complaint, just an honest reflection. And honestly, it stuck with me.So I sat with Javeria Rafique, who handles our talent acquisition with so much heart, and Muhammad Shehrayar Khan, who looks after both IT support and our HRIS/ATS setup. We had a simple goal: let‚Äôs make joining feel smoother.We didn‚Äôt go big. Just: * Shared a clear ‚Äúwhat to expect‚Äù for Day 1 * Made sure logins and HRIS access were ready before the person arrived *Added a bit of structure and support for that first-day experienceAnd the difference? Huge. People felt more confident, less anxious and actually excited to start.Sometimes it‚Äôs not about big initiatives. It‚Äôs about small, thoughtful moments that make someone feel seen.Would love to know , what‚Äôs one small thing your team changed that made a real impact?

Hiring freshers can bring fresh energy, new perspectives, and a long-term investment in talent. While they may lack direct experience, fresh graduates often come with a strong academic foundation, a willingness to learn, and a high level of adaptability. They are eager to prove themselves and can quickly adapt to company culture, bringing innovative ideas and enthusiasm to the workplace.By hiring freshers, companies can mold and shape talent to meet their specific needs, building a workforce that is loyal and aligned with the company's values and goals.Additionally, freshers are often more cost-effective in terms of salary and can grow within the organization, reducing recruitment costs in the long run. Investing in young talent also helps create a diverse and dynamic team, ensuring that businesses stay ahead of industry trends by fostering a culture of learning and continuous improvement.Ultimately, hiring freshers is an opportunity for organizations to invest in the future, building a sustainable and motivated workforce that can drive long-term success.hashtag#hiring hashtag#partimehashtag#fulltime hashtag#workinghashtag#onlineworkinghashtag#hiring hashtag#nowhashtag#partimehashtag#oportunityhashtag#workfromhomehashtag#workfromofficehashtag#delhi hashtag#noidahashtag#linkdin hashtag#india

Hello everyone, let us discuss the another topic today,shall we..!!Here it is,Tittle:Informed Consent Form (ICF): A Cornerstone of Ethical Clinical ResearchAfter the Protocol is developed and approved, the next critical step in any clinical trial is the preparation of the Informed Consent Form (ICF).Why is the ICF so important?It ensures that every participant:‚úÖ Understands the purpose of the study‚úÖ Is aware of the procedures, risks, and benefits‚úÖ Knows their rights, including the right to withdraw at any time‚úÖ Voluntarily agrees to participateKey Highlights:‚Äì Ethical obligation: Upholds respect for participants' autonomy‚Äì Regulatory requirement: No enrollment without IRB/IEC-approved ICF‚Äì Participant-centered: Must be clear, concise, and in layman's termsRemember:The ICF is not just a form ‚Äì it's a meaningful conversation that builds trust between the researcher and the participant.What are your thoughts on improving ICF comprehension and accessibility?hashtag#ClinicalResearch hashtag#InformedConsent hashtag#ICF hashtag#EthicsInResearch hashtag#ClinicalTrials hashtag#GCP hashtag#PatientCentricity hashtag#ResearchEthics hashtag#ClinicalOperations hashtag#hiring hashtag#Recuirters hashtag#Jobsearch hashtag#Fresher hashtag#Fresherhiring hashtag#hiringalter hashtag#jobalter hashtag#openings hashtag#immediatejoining
